page.title: 05SALISBURY PLAIN FOLKLAW
page.content: Some signs of coming rain are: Moles throw up larger hills. Sheep rise early to graze. Elderly cats behave like kittens. Spiders wait at the entrance to their webs. Rooks feed close to their rookeries. Some Traditional Cures: For Warts: Cover with a cobweb which is afterwards burnt, or rub with a piece of raw steak, and bury it secretly in the ground. The wart would then disappear as the steak rotted. For Cramp: Put corks under the pillow or tie them round the affected limb. Marjoram oil: Soothed toothache, relieved earache, and marjoram tea helped keep infection from the chest and lungs. The Nettle was another "cure all" for glandular trouble and gout.
